content: the foot chart in stranded knitting as for the leg the last round in dark red is the first round for the toe toe appropriately for a christmas stocking this is a star toe but feel free to substitute the toe construc- tion of your choice using the toe colour of your choice knit the toe as follows round 1 k2tog k8 repeat 8 times 72 sts k 5 rounds according to toe chart round 7 k2tog k7 repeat 8 times 64 sts k 4 rounds round 12 k2tog k6 repeat 8 times 56 sts k 3 rounds round 16 k2tog k5 repeat 8 times 48 sts k 2 rounds round 19 k2tog k4 repeat 8 times 40 sts k 1 round round 21 k2tog k3 repeat 8 times 32 sts k 1 round round 23 k2tog k2 repeat 8 times 24 sts round 24 k2tog k1 repeat 8 times 16 sts round 25 k2tog 8 times 8 sts break yarn pull end through your live sts twice around and pull tight to close the opening hohoho page 4 loop using dpns cast on 4 sts and work an i-cord long enough to hang the stocking from about 20 cms joining cast on and cast off sew to the inside of the stocking at the centre back at the base of the hem this will be perfectly fine to take the weight of the stocking however if you are planning to fill it with generous amounts of very heavy gifts i would suggest you work the i-cord around a core of parcel string to make sure the weight of the stocking doesn t stretch it out too much this should complete the sock - apart from the enviable task of sewing up all those threads i know it would be very tempting to just knot them and let them hanging if you are planning to use this as an ornament only however weaving the yarn end through the row in the back not only strenghens the join at that point it is also a good opportunity to tidy up some stitches that have the wrong ten- sion and it helps a lot to disguise the jog that occurs between the bands of pattern hang the sock on the mantle piece place a plate of cookies and a glass of milk underneath and make sure your chimney is well swept ho ho ho hohoho page 5 heel stitches heel stitches leg chart hohoho page 6 foot chart toe chart hohoho page 7
